sources.title: Battling Marshal
sources.description: Plot-wise an unconventional B-western starring Sunset Carson (a.k.a. Winifred Maurice Harrison). The glitch-free print has viewable video quality, but the audio is badly distorted. Posted for archival purposes. Filmed in Pearblossom, CA.. Directed by Oliver Drake. Released in 1950 (see note). Two minutes are missing. NOTE: Produced in 1947, but not released until 1950.

metadata.Plot: Sunset comes to the aid of a family in trouble. A vein of gold has been found on their land and the bad guys are out to take it over. This time they use a fake Doctor who claims there is an epidemic of smallpox and he tries to apply a poisonous injection. When Sunset breaks that up, the henchmen are brought in for the attack.
metadata.Actors: Sunset Carson, Cactus Jr., Al Terry
